GENERAL.FURTHERINFORMATION: ~p~Station staff~w~ require your assistance; they need you to apprehend someone who may've ~y~failed to pay the train fare.~w~

OUTCOME0.OTHER: A nearby station told me they've jumped the barriers there. Impressive, but a criminal offence.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You: ~w~Excuse me, could you wait there for a minute?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Make it quick, I have a train to catch.
~b~You: ~w~I've spoken with a ticket enforcement officer, and they've told me you jumped the barriers?
~r~Suspect: ~w~Pfff. It really isn't a big deal. I don't have any spare change on me, can you just let is slide?
~b~You: ~w~It's an offence to use the train without paying a fare, I'll be writing you up a ticket.
~r~Suspect: ~w~Well get on with it then.
~b~You: ~w~Here it is. You can use the train now as you'll pay a fine, but next time pay your fare like everybody else.
~r~Suspect: ~w~This fine is expensive, I don't believe it. Well, I guess I should've just bought a ticket.

OUTCOME1.OTHER: I noticed a ticket someone has; it looks unusual, I've got a feeling it may be a fake one. It is unfortunate that they've become increasingly common.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Hi there, could you stay there for me please?
~r~Suspect:~w~ Of course officer, how can I be of your assistance?
~b~You:~w~ We were called by the train station staff, they were wondering how you got through the gates?
~r~Suspect:~w~ Well, I have a ticket, that's how I got through.
~b~You:~w~ I see, could I take a look at it please?
~r~Suspect:~w~ Uh, sure. I don't see why you should need to though.
~b~You:~w~ It says here the ticket expired a week ago, do you know why that is?
~r~Suspect:~w~ No way, really! I have no idea how that could be.
~b~You:~w~ Don't play dumb with me, you've delibrately used an old ticket. I'm issuing you a fine.
~r~Suspect:~w~ Honestly, do something useful with your life for once. Give me the ticket, then I'm leaving.
~b~You:~w~ Here it is.
~r~Suspect:~w~ Thank you so much for this. You ruined my day.

OUTCOME2.OTHER: My colleague at another station radioed in. Apparently they may not have a ticket on them, however my colleague wasn't watching the camera's unfortunately.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Hi there, could you stay there for me please?
~r~Suspect:~w~ Of course officer, how can I be of your assistance?
~b~You:~w~ I've been asked to check if you have a ticket on you.
~r~Suspect:~w~ I don't know, do I?
~b~You:~w~ This isn't a joke, I'll need an honest answer please.
~r~Suspect:~w~ Oh for Christ's sake! Catch criminals, not people who want to go on a train.
~b~You:~w~ I'll ask once again, do you have a ticket on you?
~r~Suspect:~w~ You have nothing better to do, do you? Let me get on the godforsaken train. It arrives soon anyway.

OUTCOME3.NOTIFICATION: Speak to the suspected ~r~fraudulent ticket seller.~w~
OUTCOME3.OTHER: I glanced at a ticket someone was using, it didn't look right. I think it is fake.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Excuse me, I need to have a conversation with you.
~r~Suspect:~w~ Of course officer, how can I be of your assistance?
~b~You:~w~ We were called by the train station staff, they were wondering how you got through the gates?
~r~Suspect:~w~ Well, I have a ticket, that's how I got through.
~b~You:~w~ I see, could I take a look at it please?
~r~Suspect:~w~ Of course, here it is.
~b~You:~w~ That's a fake ticket, you can tell by the markings on the side. Why are you using it?
~r~Suspect:~w~ At the entrance of the station someone was selling it, it must've been at least half the cost of a regular ticket.
~b~You:~w~ I see, so you bought it off him at this cheaper price?
~r~Suspect:~w~ I did yes. Look, here's my ID. I'm not a criminal, I promise.
~b~You:~w~ Thank you. I'll see if I can find this person you mentioned.
~b~You:~w~ Hold up for a minute. We need to have a word.
~r~Suspect:~w~ Another day, another officer up in my business. What?
~b~You:~w~ We've got suspicion to believe you've been selling fraudulent tickets.
~b~You:~w~ I'm going to detain you, stay there for me.
~r~Suspect:~w~ My hands are up!

OUTCOME4.OTHER: A person apparently, I've heard over the radio, didn't use a ticket.

DIALOGUES.DIALOGUE: ~b~You:~w~ Hi there, could you stay there for me please?
~r~Suspect:~w~ Of course officer, how can I be of your assistance?
~b~You:~w~ We were called by the train station staff, they were wondering how you got through the gates?
~r~Suspect:~w~ Like everyone else, with my train ticket.
~b~You:~w~ Mind if I take a look at it?
~r~Suspect:~w~ Uh, sure. I don't see why you should need to though.
~b~You:~w~ Seems like everything is okay, have a good rest of your journey!
~y~Station Officer:~w~ Good to see you officer, thank you for arriving so promptly.
~b~You:~w~ That's absolutely fine, could you provide some details on the situation please?
~y~Station Officer:~w~ {0}
~b~You:~w~ I see. Not good to say the least. Where would they be now?
~y~Station Officer:~w~ There haven't been any trains yet, so they'll probably be on the platform.
~b~You:~w~ Thank you for all your help, I'll get to them now.
~y~Station Officer:~w~ Apologies for the call over something so petty, it's appreciated.
~b~You:~w~ That's absolutely fine, could you provide some details on the situation please?
~y~Station Officer:~w~ {0}
~b~You:~w~ Right, looks like we have a fare dodger on our hands. Where might they be?
~y~Station Officer:~w~ Let me think. They must be on the platform, that's the only place they could be.
~b~You:~w~ Got it, well, I will check there first!
